chapter.title: OpenStack client
chapter.para:
The openstack client is a common OpenStack command-line interface (CLI).
This chapter documents openstack version 0.4.1.
For help on a specific openstack command, enter:

listitem.para: show program's version number and exit
Increase verbosity of output. Can be repeated.
Specify a file to log output. Disabled by default.
suppress output except warnings and errors
show this help message and exit
show tracebacks on errors
Authentication URL (Env: OS_AUTH_URL)
Domain name of the requested domain-level authorization scope (Env: OS_DOMAIN_NAME)
Domain ID of the requested domain-level authorization scope (Env: OS_DOMAIN_ID)
Project name of the requested project-level authorization scope (Env: OS_PROJECT_NAME)
Project ID of the requested project-level authorization scope (Env: OS_PROJECT_ID)
Authentication username (Env: OS_USERNAME)
Authentication password (Env: OS_PASSWORD)
Domain name of the user (Env: OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME)
Domain ID of the user (Env: OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID)
Domain name of the project which is the requested project-level authorization scope (Env: OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME)
Domain ID of the project which is the requested project-level authorization scope (Env: OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID)
Authentication region name (Env: OS_REGION_NAME)
CA certificate bundle file (Env: OS_CACERT)
Verify server certificate (default)
Disable server certificate verification
Default domain ID, default=default (Env: OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN)
Defaults to env[OS_TOKEN]
Defaults to env[OS_URL]
Print API call timing info
Compute API version, default=2 (Env: OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION)
Network API version, default=2 (Env: OS_NETWORK_API_VERSION)
Image API version, default=1 (Env: OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION)
Volume API version, default=1 (Env: OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION)
Identity API version, default=2.0 (Env: OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION)
Trust ID to use when authenticating. This can only be used with Keystone v3 API (Env: OS_TRUST_ID)
Object API version, default=1 (Env: OS_OBJECT_API_VERSION)
Show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack aggregate add host [-h] [-f {shell,table,value}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--variable VARIABLE] [--prefix PREFIX] <aggregate> <host>

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate
Host to add to aggregate
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack aggregate create [-h] [-f {shell,table,value}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--variable VARIABLE] [--prefix PREFIX] [--zone <availability-zone>] [--property <key=value>] <name>

listitem.para: New aggregate name
show this help message and exit
Availability zone name
Property to add to this aggregate (repeat option to set multiple properties)
Name or ID of aggregate to delete
show this help message and exit
show this help message and exit
List additional fields in output

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate
Host to remove from aggregate
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack aggregate set [-h] [-f {shell,table,value}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--variable VARIABLE] [--prefix PREFIX] [--name <new-name>] [--zone <availability-zone>] [--property <key=value>] <aggregate>

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate to display
show this help message and exit
New aggregate name
Availability zone name
Property to add/change for this aggregate (repeat option to set multiple properties)

listitem.para: Name or ID of aggregate to display
show this help message and exit

show this help message and exit
ID of backup to restore
ID of volume to restore to

Select an availability zone for the server
Map block devices; map is <id>:<type>:<size(GB)>:<delete_on_terminate> (optional extension)
Specify NIC configuration (optional extension)
Hints for the scheduler (optional extension)
Use specified volume as the config drive, or 'True' to use an ephemeral drive
